summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for August 13, 2019, detailing routine prison operations, staff leave, inmate counts, and facility status. It is significant as it provides a snapshot of the prison's administrative functions on a date shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the same facility.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine prison operations including new inmate admissions, releases, staff assignments, and facility status reports. The report notes a staff shortage leading to a vacated correctional officer post and an inoperative fire panel.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York
locations.context: The federal prison facility where this daily activity report was generated.

locations.name: Special Housing Unit (SHU)
locations.context: A segregated unit within the prison where inmate Dumes was admitted.

keyFacts: The report documents routine prison operations at MCC New York on August 13, 2019, one day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility.
It notes a staff shortage that resulted in a correctional officer post being vacated on the 10-South unit.
The facility's Control Center Fire Panel was reported as inoperative.
Four new inmates were admitted and thirteen inmates were released from MCC New York on this date.
One inmate, Dumes (#77665-054), was admitted to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
